author: Anonymous Poet
title: Catching Up on Labs
question:
After reviewing the syllabus, as recommended in previous posts, I was unable to find a clear answer to what should happen besides request (and wait) to be placed into a section. If we missed a lab this week due to space issues, do we receive a 0% or is it omitted? Of course we should complete it for our learning, but I think its unclear on how the assessment for the missed lab will run, especially since I was told by the CPSC undergrad office to wait until I was placed into a viable section.
Thank you for any information you can provide.
Edit: yes I have read @6, but it seems like this is common, consistent question.
instructor_answer:
I believe this is the relevant section of the Syllabus.  I believe this addresses your question, but if there's a specific point here that is unclear let us know and we can try to improve the text.
I'm registered in a lecture section, but all the lab sections that fit my course schedule are full. What should I do?
Closely monitor the SSC website to see if space opens up in the lab section you want. Up to the add/drop deadline, attend a lab section that fits your course schedule. Identify yourself to the TA as a student who is hoping to get into that lab. If you still don't have a lab section by the second lab, email cpsc110-admin@cs.ubc.ca and describe your situation. Since you are registered in a lecture section, we will ensure that you end up in a lab section that fits your course schedule. This may not be your preferred lab section, however.
